title: US to ‘aggressively revoke visas for Chinese students’, Rubio says – live
snippets:
US secretary of state says administration also to ‘revise criteria’ for all visa applications from China and Hong Kong

The vice-president, JD Vance, is scheduled to deliver the keynote address at the Bitcoin 2025 Conference in Vegas, which will set out the Trump administration’s turbocharged approach to the US crypto industry.

If you cast your minds back, it’s the same conference Trump spoke at last year in Nashville calling for America to become a “bitcoin superpower” and the “crypto capital of the planet” under his leadership.

At 4:30pm ET, Trump’s sons Eric and Donald Trump Jr will speak at the very same conference in Vegas. It’s presumably an industry they feel invested in, given they back a major Bitcoin venture themselves, per Reuters. And it comes just a day after a separate family-linked business, the Trump Media & Technology Group, announced its intention to raise $2.5bn to invest in bitcoin, as the Wall Street Journal reports. And that in turn came after Trump offered out exclusive VIP dinner invites to the 220 top buyers of his personal $Trump memecoin, as an incentive to buy more stock. It’s all head-spinning stuff for a president of the United States.

Continue reading...

titles: US to ‘aggressively revoke visas for Chinese students’, Rubio says – live
US to ‘aggressively revoke visas for Chinese students’, Rubio says – live
summary: The Trump administration plans to revise visa application criteria for China and Hong Kong. Vice-President JD Vance will outline a proactive stance on the US crypto industry at the Bitcoin 2025 Conference in Vegas, a move consistent with Trump's ambition for the US to dominate the global cryptocurrency market. Trump's sons, Eric and Donald Trump Jr., are also engaged in the crypto sector, backing significant Bitcoin ventures. Additionally, the Trump Media & Technology Group aims to raise $2.5 billion for Bitcoin investments, highlighting the administration's deep investment in cryptocurrency.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful information about the Trump administration's plans for visa application criteria and its stance on the US crypto industry. It also offers insight into the administration's investment in cryptocurrency. However, it doesn't report on solutions or improvements and doesn't increase clarity around systems, causes, or impacts.

title: Australia news live: Ley defends demotion of women from shadow cabinet and denies Hume was punished for work-from-home policy failure
snippets:
Opposition leader says she will bring her perspective as a carer and working mother to the leadership. Follow today’s news live

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

McCormack says he expects Nationals to revisit net zero position eventually

McCormack expects the Nationals to revisit net zero by 2050:

I think we need to have a very serious discussion about that. When I go to places such as Crookwell, and others, where they have got huge wind towers, they have done their heft lift as far as making sure they put these massive turbines up, the solar … that are popping up all over, taking up arable country, farmland, you know.

I think regional Australia has done its fair share and we need to revisit that, given the fact the world, indeed America and other countries and other political parties in other nations, have really revisited this net zero. I think the Nationals will do the same.

Look, you never say never. I’m not going to draw a line through my name because that would be silly, but, look, it’s up to the party room. It’s the gift of the party room. I have always accepted that.

I had the great honour of leading the party for three and a bit years and being the deputy prime minister at the same time. [A] truly great honour. One that I’ll cherish. But if it comes to pass that the party decides that I’m the one to lead them again in the future so be it.

Continue reading...

title: Calgary researchers using ‘citizen science’ for a study on invasive mosquitoes
snippets: Calgary researchers are using 'citizen science' to help determine how an invasive species of mosquito, which is a carrier of the West Nile virus, can survive Alberta's winter.
titles: Calgary researchers using ‘citizen science’ for a study on invasive mosquitoes
summary: Calgary researchers are engaging the public in a 'citizen science' project to study the survival mechanisms of an invasive mosquito species known to carry the West Nile virus during Alberta's winter. This initiative aims to understand how these mosquitoes can withstand cold temperatures, contributing to efforts to manage and possibly mitigate the spread of the virus in the area.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive. It reports on an innovative solution to study the survival mechanisms of an invasive mosquito species, provides actionable insights for the public to participate in 'citizen science', and increases awareness about efforts to manage and possibly mitigate the spread of the West Nile virus.

title: Trump laments size of ‘much too big’ airplane gifted by Qatar
snippets:
The Boeing 747-8, a present from the Gulf state, is more than 18ft longer than the current Air Force One

Donald Trump’s big, beautiful new plane from the government of Qatar has arrived – but the US president says it’s too big to be his personal perk.

The problem for the US president is not the smack of impropriety that comes with accepting a luxury 747 jumbo jet from the Gulf state and intended as a replacement Air Force One – Trump has already brushed off any criticism on that front.

This article was modified on 28 May 2025 to clarify the context in which Donald Trump said the jet gifted by Qatar was too big.

Continue reading...
titles: Trump laments size of ‘much too big’ airplane gifted by Qatar
summary: The government of Qatar gifted Donald Trump a Boeing 747-8, intended as a replacement for Air Force One. The plane, over 18ft longer than the current Air Force One, has been deemed too big by Trump for personal use. Despite potential impropriety concerns of accepting such a luxury jet, Trump has dismissed criticism. The article's context was clarified on May 28, 2025, emphasizing Trump's stance on the size of the jet rather than the ethical implications of its acceptance.
constructiveness_reason: This story offers basic awareness about a situation involving a former US president and a foreign government. However, it lacks depth or insight, focusing more on the sensational aspect of the plane's size rather than the ethical implications of its acceptance.

title: Canadian doctors group challenging constitutionality of Alberta transgender law
snippets: The Canadian Medical Association is challenging the constitutionality of Alberta's legislation limiting access to medical treatment for transgender youth.
titles: Canadian doctors group challenging constitutionality of Alberta transgender law
summary: The Canadian Medical Association has initiated a legal challenge against Alberta's legislation, arguing it is unconstitutional because it restricts medical treatment access for transgender youth. This action underscores a significant dispute over healthcare rights for transgender individuals in the province.
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights a significant dispute over healthcare rights for transgender individuals. It increases awareness about the issue, provides understanding of the legal challenge, and contributes to the reader's knowledge about the ongoing debate on transgender rights in Canada.

title: McVay admits Rams considering reunion with Jalen Ramsey, but trade discussions haven't heated up
snippets: The Los Angeles Rams would still love a reunion with Jalen Ramsey if they can swing a trade to reacquire the star cornerback from the Miami Dolphins.  Rams coach Sean McVay also said Wednesday that those trade discussions haven't advanced in recent weeks — and if a deal doesn't happen, McVay is quite happy to enter the new season with the defensive backs already on Los Angeles' roster.  After a workout during organized team activities, McVay reiterated the Rams' interest in the key defensive back on their Super Bowl championship team three years ago.
titles: McVay admits Rams considering reunion with Jalen Ramsey, but trade discussions haven't heated up
summary: The Los Angeles Rams, led by coach Sean McVay, have expressed interest in reacquiring star cornerback Jalen Ramsey from the Miami Dolphins. However, McVay noted that trade discussions have not progressed recently. Despite this, he expressed contentment with the current roster of defensive backs if a deal does not materialize. The Rams value Ramsey, a pivotal player in their Super Bowl championship team three years ago, but are prepared to move forward without him if necessary.
constructiveness_reason: This story informs readers about a potential player trade in the NFL, providing useful context about the player's history with the team and the current state of trade discussions. However, it doesn't report on solutions or improvements, nor does it significantly increase clarity around systems, causes, or impacts.

title: Arcia signs with Rockies, joins lineup as DH versus Cubs
snippets: Infielder Orlando Arcia signed with the Colorado Rockies on Wednesday, and was in their lineup as the designated hitter against the Cubs in Chicago, three days after he was released by Atlanta.  The 30-year-old Arcia, an NL All-Star in 2023, was Atlanta's opening day shortstop this season, but lost the job to Nick Allen.  Arcia was batting .194 with one RBI through 14 games when Atlanta designated him for assignment on May 23, then cut him.
titles: Arcia signs with Rockies, joins lineup as DH versus Cubs
summary: Orlando Arcia, a 30-year-old infielder and 2023 NL All-Star, signed with the Colorado Rockies and played as the designated hitter against the Cubs in Chicago, just three days post his release from Atlanta. Arcia, who began the season as Atlanta's opening day shortstop, lost his position to Nick Allen. At the time of his release, he had a .194 batting average with one RBI across 14 games. His departure from Atlanta came after being designated for assignment on May 23.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about player transfers in baseball, including the reasons for the transfer and the player's performance. It contributes to the reader's understanding of the player's career trajectory and the team's decision-making. However, it does not report on solutions, improvements, or attempts to solve problems.

title: Court strikes down Trump reciprocal tariffs
snippets: The judges wrote that a 1977 law, which Trump invoked to justify the tariffs, does not actually give the president the power to issue the sweeping duties initiated last month.
titles: Court strikes down Trump reciprocal tariffs
summary: Judges have determined that the 1977 law cited by former President Trump does not grant the authority to impose the broad tariffs he initiated last month. This ruling clarifies the limits of presidential power regarding the imposition of tariffs.
constructiveness_reason: This story informs readers about a recent court ruling and its implications for presidential powers and tariffs. It provides useful context about the 1977 law and how it has been interpreted, contributing to the reader's understanding of the legal and political systems.

title: This Common Oral Bacterium Can Invade Your Heart
snippets: Gum disease bacteria can reach the heart, causing damage that raises AFib risk. Good oral hygiene may help protect heart health. Tempted to skip flossing? It might not be worth the risk. A new study from Hiroshima University (HU) has found that the gum disease bacterium Porphyromonas gingivalis (P. gingivalis) can enter the bloodstream and [...]
titles: This Common Oral Bacterium Can Invade Your Heart
summary: A study by Hiroshima University has discovered that the bacterium Porphyromonas gingivalis, commonly associated with gum disease, can travel from the mouth to the heart, potentially increasing the risk of atrial fibrillation (AFib), a heart condition. This finding underscores the importance of maintaining good oral hygiene, including regular flossing, to protect heart health.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides readers with actionable insights about maintaining good oral hygiene to protect heart health. It also increases awareness about the connection between oral bacteria and heart conditions.

title: USC Scientists Unveil 5-in-1 Blood Test for Early Alzheimer’s Detection
snippets: In a proof-of-concept study, the test successfully identified five critical biomarkers associated with Alzheimer’s disease, exceeding the capabilities of currently available commercial blood tests. Researchers at the Keck School of Medicine of USC have created a  new blood test that could make it easier to detect Alzheimer’s disease early. This innovative tool, called the Penta-Plex [...]
titles: USC Scientists Unveil 5-in-1 Blood Test for Early Alzheimer’s Detection
summary: Scientists at the Keck School of Medicine of USC have developed a new blood test, known as the Penta-Plex, capable of detecting five key biomarkers associated with Alzheimer's disease. This test, which has been successful in early trials, surpasses existing commercial blood tests in its ability to identify the disease at an early stage.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive as it reports on an innovation in the field of medical science that could potentially help detect Alzheimer's disease early. It provides readers with a deeper understanding of the progress being made in Alzheimer's detection.

title: Brain Reset: One Molecular Switch Could Silence Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s
snippets: A scientist has discovered a biochemical “master switch” that connects and potentially cures Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s. His theory may revolutionize brain disease treatment and sustainable medicine. At the upcoming Sustainability Through Science and Technology Summit 2025 (SIPS 2025), Nobel Laureate Prof. Aaron Ciechanover will be honored in a special event taking place in Cebu, Philippines, [...]
titles: Brain Reset: One Molecular Switch Could Silence Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s
summary: A scientist has discovered a biochemical "master switch" that could potentially treat Alzheimer's and Parkinson's, offering a revolutionary approach to brain disease treatment. This breakthrough will be recognized at the Sustainability Through Science and Technology Summit 2025 (SIPS 2025), where Nobel Laureate Prof. Aaron Ciechanover will be honored in Cebu, Philippines.
constructiveness_reason: This story is very constructive as it highlights a significant breakthrough in the potential treatment of Alzheimer's and Parkinson's. It informs readers about the progress being made in the field of brain disease treatment, which can empower those affected by these conditions.

title: We’re about to unlock the secrets of ancient human brains
snippets: For the first time, we have a method for extracting proteins from preserved soft tissues like brains – which could be a treasure trove of evolutionary information
titles: We’re about to unlock the secrets of ancient human brains
summary: Scientists have developed a new method to extract proteins from preserved soft tissues, such as brains, for the first time. This breakthrough could significantly enhance our understanding of evolutionary processes by providing access to a wealth of previously inaccessible biological information.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a significant scientific breakthrough, which could enhance our understanding of human evolution. It contributes to the reader's knowledge and potentially, their decision-making regarding related scientific or educational pursuits.

title: Massive glacier collapse triggers landslide that buries Swiss village
snippets: Villagers in Blatten, Switzerland, were evacuated earlier this month after authorities warned a nearby glacier was on the brink of collapse – one of many becoming less stable as global temperature rise
titles: Massive glacier collapse triggers landslide that buries Swiss village
summary: Residents of Blatten, Switzerland, were evacuated earlier this month due to the imminent risk of a nearby glacier collapsing. This event underscores the growing instability of glaciers worldwide as a result of rising global temperatures.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the impacts of climate change, increasing the reader's awareness of this global issue. However, it doesn't offer any solutions or insights into how these problems might be mitigated, which limits its constructiveness.
